In the coming years, she would like to expand her business and open a shop.  She says that with the profits, she plans to get married next year.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y activa; vive en la casa propia de ella que hace varios años llegó a comprar con mucho esfuerzo; ahora habita junto a sus dos hijas Katerin de 18 años y Ruth de 13 años. La labor de Yolanda es muy tranquila aunque siempre hay momentos de preocupación; ella cuenta con su negocio de abarrotes en la comunidad donde habita;  los ingresos de su labor llegan a cubrir los gastos necesarios para el bienestar de sus hijas como de sí misma. Yolanda siempre esta realizando sus ventas en compañía de sus consumidoras quienes conversan durante las compras. Una de sus preocupaciones es que se quede sin mercadería porque si fuese así no tendría ventas. Es por ello que acude a MFP para solicitar un crédito que apoye con sus planes de trabajo; sus planes a futuro es dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijas. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP; y se compromete a ser puntual como en anterior préstamo; asimismo, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por ser personas que cumplen con sus pagos de manera puntual. 
Con el crédito obtenido comprará productos de abarrotes para su negocio, como por ejemplo: arroz, leche, verduras, conservas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 34 years old, and a determined, energetic woman. She lives in her own home, which she managed to buy several years ago, with a lot of effort.

Now she lives with her two daughters: Katerin, 18, and Ruth, 13.  Yolanda's work is very peaceful, although there are always times when she worries. She has a grocery store in the community where she lives. The income from her work covers the necessary expenses for her well-being and that of her daughter. 

In carrying out her sales, Yolanda is always with her customers, who talk to her while making their purchases. One of her worries is being left without merchandise, because if she were, she wouldn't have sales. This is why she is approaching MFP to apply for a loan that will support her work plans. Her plan for the future is to give her two daughters a better quality of life.

This will be her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time, as with her previous loan.  As well, she is grateful to the members of the communal bank for being people who make their payments on time. 

With the loan, she will buy grocery products for her business, such as rice, milk, vegetables, canned goods, and other things.

loans.use: To buy products for her store, such as rice, milk, vegetables, and canned goods.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace más de 10 años ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde entonces comenta que le ha ido muy bien en este negocio.

Los insumos para elaborar las tortillas como el maíz lo compra en la zona, la leña ella misma la va a cortar y la lleva hasta su casa.

El préstamo que María esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una galera para elaborar y vender sus tortillas, pues ella comenta que en época de invierno siempre se moja donde tiene la hornilla y la leña. Con la inversión tendrá comodidad ya que en la época lluviosa no pasara la misma dificultad que el año pasado. Así trabajara de manera constante y el invierno no representara una dificultad para su trabajo. En un futuro ella desea comprar las ventanas y el piso para su casa.
texts.en:
María is 53, and a widow with three children. She has made and sold tortillas for more than 10 years. She says that this business has gone very well in that time.

She will buy the ingredients for making the tortillas, such as corn, in the area.  She herself is going to cut the firewood and take it to her house.

The loan that María is applying to Fundación Campo for is to build a covered shed for making and selling her tortillas, as she says that in the wintertime, the place where she has the oven and firewood always gets wet. 

With the investment she will have comfort, as in the rainy season she won't experience the same difficulty as last year. This way she will work steadily, and winter won't represent a difficulty for her work.

In the future she wishes to buy windows and install a floor for her house.

loans.use: To build a covered shed for selling her tortillas.

loans.name: Abdusaid

texts.ru: Абдусаид 42-летний мужчина, проживающий в самом последнем кишлаке Джамоата Утконсой, совсем рядом с горами.Он занимается выращиванием и продажей арахиса, а также и бизнесом по откорму и продажи скота. В основном он разводит крупнорогатый скот, коров. Ему помогает его старший сын и жена.Она доит и продаёт молоко сельским жителям.Семейный доход Абдусаида еле хватает на проживание, поэтому он хочет в кредит увеличить численность коров ,купив ещё одну дойную корову и несколько мешков сена для них.
texts.en:
Abdusaid is a 42-year-old man who lives in the very last village of the jamoat of Utkansoi, very close to the mountains (a "jamoat" is an administrative division in Tajikistan).  
He grows and sells peanuts, and also fattens up and sells livestock.  His livestock mostly consists of large cattle such as cows.  His oldest son and wife help him with the business.  His wife milks the cows and sells milk to the village residents.  However, Abdusaid's family income is barely sufficient to live, and this is why he is requesting a loan in order to increase his number of cows.  He would like to buy one additional dairy cow and a few bags of hay for his herd.

loans.use: to buy one cow.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 60-year-old man who is married and has seven children. He has a farming business in Emali.  He has been in the business for 20 years now and gets a monthly income of 3,000 shillings.

This will be Jackson’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase fertilizer, poultry medicine and vaccines for hens. With the profit that he will get, he wants to buy chicks and chicken feed. 

In the future, he wants to become a recognized farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, medicine and vaccines for hens

loans.name: George Masambo

texts.en:
George is a 31-year-old man who is married and has three children. He has been running a motorcycle business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of 3,000 shillings.

This will be George’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy spare parts.  With the profit that he will get, he wants to pay his children’s school fees. 

In the future, he wants to become stable financially.

loans.use: to buy motor bike spare parts

loans.name: Carolyne Jumba

texts.en:
Carolyne is 33 years old and a single mother of two children who are 12 and 10 years old, respectively. She sells cosmetics, a business she started two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cosmetics and acquire premises and a license for her business. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her buy more stock for her business. Her dream is to be financially stable, open a cosmetic distribution centre as well as educate her children. This is her first loan

loans.use: To acquire premises and a license for her business and to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Geoffrey Langat

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a father of three children who are five, four and three years old. He lives with his family in Litein, South Rift Kenya. His farm produces milk and tea for the local market.

Geoffrey has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says this will improve his milk output and ease provision of basic needs for the family.

He laments of drought and the high costs of capital as being the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Patricia Muindi

texts.en:
Juliana is a 30-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a retail shop in Emali. She has been in the business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of 4,000 shillings. 

This will be Juliana’s first loan from KADET LTD, She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock With the profit that she will get, she wants to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she wants to be able to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tissue, salt, and sugar to sell

loans.name: John Ronoh

texts.en:
John is 47 years old and has been in the farming business for over 10 years in his home area of Litein. He also runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income to farming business. He is married with five children with the first born being 18 years and the last six years.

John has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He is optimistic his milk output will go up and he will have enough milk for family consumption and additional income to meet other basic family needs.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for financial support to farmers but laments that the effect of drought and poor markets for farm produce within the local markets blows out the hard earned income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses Likovele

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old, married to Rhoda and blessed with three children who are 16, 14 and 10 years old, respectively. He has been farming for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 62,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The profit he gets will help him expand his farming by purchasing more land. 

He hopes to be a successful farmer. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris, de 28 años, es una mujer amable, entusiasta y muy responsable, es conviviente con Arturo de 30 años con quien tiene tres hijos, Antonio de 7, Isis de 1 y Alondra de 1, vive en su casa propia y trabaja arduo para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Durante mucho años, Damaris solo dependía de los ingresos que su conviviente traía para el hogar, hasta que en un momento dado empezó a hacer falta mejorar su calidad de vida, es así que decide trabajar y que a la vez le permita estar a lado a sus hijos y no descuidar de su hogar, es así como emprende su proyecto de la venta de calzados. Desde hace 2 años viene ofreciendo a sus clientes los diferentes modelos de zapatos, sandalias y zapatillas de muy buena calidad y de modelos actuales, está muy contenta pues durante el tiempo que lleva con su negocio le va muy bien. Como toda mujer que desea surgir, ella tiene muchos planes para su vida, entre los que está dar una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener un negocio prospero y que le sea rentable, pero sabe que aun le falta mucho y por el momento solo desea consolidarse mas con lo que hace y mas adelante ampliar con otros productos su negocio. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo una cliente puntual y pagar sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas mercaderías para seguir con su trabajo, entre las cosas que traerá serán, zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y algunas medias para vender a sus clientes quienes siempre le piden innovar en los diseños.
texts.en: Damaris is 28 years old; she is a kind, enthusiastic and very responsible woman. She lives with Arturo, who is 30, and with whom she has three children: Antonio aged 7 and Isis and Alondra both aged 1. She lives in her own house and works hard to offer her family a better quality of life. For many years, Damaris solely depended on the income her partner brought into the home, until a given moment when she began to need to improve their quality of life. It is because of this she decided to work, and which at the same time, allowed her to be at her children’s side and not neglect the home. It is how she embarked on her project selling footwear. For two years she has been offering her customers different styles of very good quality and modern shoes, sandals and trainers. As all good women that wish to progress, she has many plans for her life, amongst them are giving her children a good education and being able to have a prosperous business that is profitable, but she knows that she still has a long way to go and for the moment she just wants to consolidate herself more in what she is doing, and later expand her business with other products. This will be her third loan with MPF, she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, since she will feel secure in advancing with her work. On the other hand, she promises to continue being a punctual client and paying her repayments as they are scheduled. She is very happy to belong to the communal bank since they are all very responsible and show solidarity. With the 1000 PEN requested, she will buy more merchandise to continue with her work; amongst the things she will carry will be shoes, sandals, trainers and some tights to sell to her customers who always ask her to introduce something new in the designs.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, trainers and socks.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 19 años, es una mujer joven, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Mirko de 23 años, quien es padre del hijo que va a tener. Ella vive en casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos, trabaja mucho pues desea esperar el nacimiento de su hijo con algunas comodidades y sin complicaciones. El trabajo de Elisa consiste en la venta de joyas en oro, plata y fantasía fina, tiene un circulo de amistades muy amplio y es ahí en donde aprovecha en vender los productos que trae de otra ciudad en donde éstos materiales son muy cómodos. Durante los dos años en éste negocio está aprendiendo muchas cosas, sobre todo el tipo de trato y a la manera de dar las facilidades de compra a sus clientes. Todo el tiempo trabaja sola, pues así se siente mejor y tiene ganancias individuales, además le gusta tener su propio horario de trabajo. espera continuar con su trabajo y seguir creciendo ya que mas adelante tiene pensado poner una joyería en donde el buen trato sea la principal atracción aparte de los modelos exclusivos y buenos precios. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado de 1,000 soles, comprará más joyas y productos para continuar con su venta, además de implementarse con algunos probadores de sortijas y franelas para limpieza de plata.
texts.en:
Elisa is 19 years old. She is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. Together with her partner, 23-year-old Mirko, she is expecting a baby. She lives in her mother’s house with her siblings and works very hard, because she wants to make sure that she is well prepared for the birth of her child. 

Elisa’s work consists of selling gold, silver and fine costume jewellery. She has a very wide circle of friends and makes the most of this to sell her products, which she brings in from another city. In the two years she has been in business she has learnt a lot, especially about customer service and the best way to sell her products. She always works alone because she feels better that way – her income is hers alone and she likes organising her own time. She hopes to be able to continue in this line of work and grow her business. She is thinking of setting up her own jeweller’s in future, where good customer service would be the principal feature, alongside exclusive models and good prices. 

This will be Elisa’s second loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have a loan so that she can fulfil her goals. She is committed to paying her instalments on time so that she doesn’t have any problems with the group she belongs to, since they are all very good, responsible people. She intends to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy more jewellery and products so that she can continue in her business, as well as buying rings and cloths for cleaning silver.

loans.use: buy more jewellery.

loans.name: Benson Makumi

texts.en:
Benson is a forty-four-year-old man, he is married with three children and he rears poultry.  He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.

This will be Benson’s second loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.  With the profit that he will get, he wants to expand his business. 

In future he wants to diversify into farming

loans.use: to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Elizabeth Teresia

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a twenty-eight-year-old woman, she is married and has three children and she owns a boutique.  She has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of three thousand three hundred shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes to sell.  In the future she wants to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Kulijambo

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old, a single mother of six children aged 26, 24, 21,18,12 and 6 years old respectively.  She sells clothes, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase two bales of comforters to sell. The profit she earns from this business will help her repay her loan. 

Her dream is to see her business expand into wholesale. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of comforters to sell.

loans.name: Joshua Bundi

texts.en:
Joshua is a father of three aged seventeen, twelve and seven years.  He has been in the farming business for three years and also works as a driver with the government.  His farm produces bananas and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Joshua has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy both a water tank and irrigation pipes in order to set up an irrigation system in his banana plantation.  He says he will use the income to pay his children's school fees and improve their living standards.

He says it has become difficult to rely on rain water for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment; a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a twenty eight-year-old lady with one child.  She has a farming business in Emali.  She has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings. 

This will be her  first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  With the profit that she will earn she wants to buy goats to rear.  In the future she would like to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine Kimweli

texts.en:
Josephine is a forty-year-old woman and she is married with three children.  She has been selling fruit for the last twelve years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be her fifth loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy more assorted fruit to sell.  With the profit, she wants to pay her children's school fees.  In the future she wants to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas Mwenda

texts.en:
Nicholas is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he grows bananas, vegetables and other fruits for the local markets.  He has been in farming for ten years and makes ballast from a local quarry to sell to local builders.  He is married with two children aged seven and five years.

Nicholas has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank to help in the irrigation of his banana and vegetable farms.  His plan is to expand his banana farm to six acres.

Nicholas lists the high costs of farm inputs and insufficient water as the major challenges he faces in his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Henry Kiara

texts.en:
Henry is aged 63 and has been in mixed farming for forty years. Besides farming, he mines building materials from the local quarry and sells to local customers. He is married with six adult children.

Henry has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the loan to construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy animals. He plans to increase the number of his dairy animals once he constructs the unit. He hopes to generate enough income to improve the living standards of his children.

He says local markets are not well developed to help farmers and he sees animal diseases as another challenge in farming. He is however grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: David Marete

texts.en:
David has been in farming in his rural home for over ten years. His farm produces maize, bananas, tomatoes, milk and passion fruits which he sells to the local market. He fully relies on farming income for the upkeep of his family of two children aged eight and two years.

David has made a fourth loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 36,750 KES. He says this will improve his farming income and  help him in improving the living standards of his family. He plans to buy a motorcycle to help in delivery of his produce to the market.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo help to smallholder farmers but adds that high costs of inputs still remains a challenge to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: David Mugambi

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He is a father of four children aged 20, twins aged 15 with the last born being 8 years ago. Besides farming, he works as a carpenter. He has been in farming for 15 years and currently sells his farm produce which includes maize, beans, wheat and potatoes to the local market.

David has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. This is his third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo after the first and second loans of 15,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively. His major focus for the future is to install an irrigation system to enable him plant in and out of season.

He says insufficient rains are the greatest limitation in farming in the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El señor Anastacio tiene 65 años de edad. Él es una persona muy trabajadora en la agricultura (granos básicos), desde pequeño se creció trabajando en la elaboración de hamacas. Luego él quedo de encargado de cuidar tres sobrinos que son los que vive en su casa.

Don Anastasio solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda. De esta manera, él vivirá en una casa más digna y cómoda para brindarles a sus sobrinos una mejor calidad de vida.

Él piensa continuar trabajando en la agricultura y apoyar a sus sobrinos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Señor Anastacio is 65 years old. He works very hard as a farmer (growing basic grains). Ever since he was little, he has worked at making hammocks. Later on he became responsible for looking after his three nephews who live with him.

Señor Anastasio is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, to buy sand, cement and iron, and to pay the labor for improving his house. This will allow him to live in a decent comfortable house and provide his nephews with a better quality of life.

He intends to continue working as a farmer and supporting his nephews in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and iron and to pay the labor to improve his house.

loans.name: Rais

texts.en:
Rais is  a 49-years-old man who is married and has three children. He is market vendor and sells different kind of food products in the central bazaar. Rais has 9 years of experience in this field, and he is considered to be a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaronis, yoghurt, ketchup, sugar and other products. The products he sells are in very high demand among the local people and they use them in everyday life. His monthly profit is 300 AZN. His spouse helps him to update the merchandise in his shop. 

This business is the only financial income in his family and Rais would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products. He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a 42-years-old man, married with four children. He sells food products such as macaronis, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Elshan has 10 years of experience in this field, and he is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 230 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Elshan would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional foods. He successfully complete two loan and AqroInvest CU trusts him!

loans.use: to buy and diversify more food products.

loans.name: Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
Comerciantes son un grupo solidario compuesto por 6 mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas actualmente están en su segundo ciclo con esta institución y escogieron este nombre porque todas en el grupo son mujeres dedicadas al comercio.

María es una de las integrantes del grupo. Está casada y tiene 55 años. Tiene 4 hijos, todos son jóvenes trabajadores y de hecho 2, trabajan con ella. Hace más de 10 años, María, junto con su familia, decidió comenzar con su negocio de herrería. Poco a poco la herrería ha ido creciendo y obteniendo una buena fama entre los vecinos de la colonia. María está solicitando este crédito pues espera poder crear un muestrario de puertas y barandales para poder atraer más clientes, ya que estos podrán ver estas muestras desde afuera del negocio. María sueña con algún día poder ampliar aun más taller y poder tener una mayor variedad de productos, para así poder tener más clientes y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Comerciantes [Merchants]  is a support group of 6 enterprising women. They are in their second cycle right now with this institution and they chose that name because they are all women who are merchants. 

María is one of the members of the group. She is 55 years old and married. She has 4 children, all of them young and hardworking. In fact, 2 of them work with her. More than 10 years ago, Maria, with her family, decided to open a metalworks business. It has grown little by little and has a good reputation among the neighborhood residents. María is asking for this loan because she hopes to create a collection of samples of doors and handrails to attract more customers. This way, they will be able to see the samples from outside of her business. María dreams of one day being able to enlarge her workshop even more and be able to have more customers and more income.

loans.use: to create a collection of samples of doors and handrails.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Salwa is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to paint her house in addition to doing some maintenance.

loans.use: to paint her home in addition to doing some maintenance

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en:
Ebtesam is a 47-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Ebtesam is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 22 años, es un joven emprendedor, con muchas ganas d sobresalir y deseos de trabajar, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres a quienes ayuda en la economía de su hogar y por quienes trabaja mucho, pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y él asegurar un futuro bueno para si mismo. A diario José, espera en la puerta de su casa la llegada de sus dos choferes a quienes da en alquiler sus mototaxis, su trabajo consiste en el alquiler de vehículos a dos personas que son muy responsables y con quienes ya trabajaba hace dos años. José es un joven que desde muy chico empezó a generar sus propios ingresos, estudia en la universidad y trabaja en una entidad en la que es muy querido, pero tiene muchas aspiraciones y deseos de crecer y tener una flota más grande de vehículos con el cual generar empleo a mas personas y él poder brindar a sus padres el tipo de vida que siempre quiso. 
Le está yendo bien en su trabajo, pero con los gastos de la universidad y el aporte a su hogar, le está dejando con poco capital, es por eso que desea tener una mototaxi mas y poder alquilarlo y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, está a la expectativa de que le brinden un apoyo para así poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y cumplir con sus metas, por otro lado se compromete a ser un cliente puntual ya que tiene muy buenas referencias del grupo al que se está incorporando por que son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi, ya que desea refaccionarlos para poder alquilarlos sin dificultad, además comprará algunos documentos que le hacen falta renovar ya que pronto se estarán venciendo.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old. He is a young entrepreneur who really wants to get ahead and work hard. He is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' house and helps support the household financially. He works very hard for them because he wants to offer them a better quality of life and ensure a better future for himself.  Every day, José waits by the door to his house for the drivers to whom he rents his motorcycle taxis. His work is renting the vehicles to two people who are very responsible and with whom he has worked for two years. José is a young man who started to generate his own income when he was very young. He goes to college and works at place where he is very well liked, but he really wants to grow and have a bigger fleet of vehicles to create more jobs for people and offer his parents the lifestyle he always wanted. 

His work is going well for him but college and household expenses are leaving him with little capital. That is why he wants to have one more motorcycle taxi so he can rent it out and improve his income. This would be his first loan with MFP. He hopes to receive support to be able to keep doing his job and achieve his goals. He is also committed to paying on time, since he has good references from the group he is joining, as they are responsible and supportive. With the 1800 soles he has asked for, he will buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi. He wants to repair them and be able to rent them out with no problems. He will also pay for some documents he needs to renew since they will expire soon.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi and update the permits.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 42-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan, and a father of five children.

Ahmad has  a small grocery store, and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more goods for his store. He is looking to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Las Posesionarias Group

texts.es:
Las Posesionarias son un grupo solidario en el municipio de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Ellas escogieron el nombre de Las Posesionarias, porque la mayoría viven en la calle Derecho de Posesión. Este grupo está compuesto por 11 personas quienes se han distinguido por ser un grupo muy puntual para sus pagos y dicen que la clave para esto es ser al grupo muy unido y con una muy buena comunicación.

Sandra es una de las señoras del grupo. Ella tiene 35 años y junto con su esposo tienen 2 hijos, un niño de 12 años y una pequeña niña de 7 los cuales actualmente están estudiando en la secundaria y en la primaria. Hace 7 meses Sandra decidió poner una pequeña papelería en su domicilio. Ella poco a poco ha ido surtiendo la papelería, sin embargo todavía le falta una variedad más amplia de productos para competir con otras papelerías más establecidas que hay por la colonia. Ella espera que con la ayuda de este crédito finalmente pueda surtir su papelería con los productos que le faltan para así poder empezar a establecerse como una de las papelerías líderes de la colonia. Ella espera en los siguientes años poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y algún día poder ampliar el espacio donde tiene su papelería.
texts.en:
Las Posesionarias are a support group in the town of Monterrey, Nuevo León. The chose the name  of Las Posesionarias because most of them live on a street called Derecho de Posesión. This group is made up of 11 people who have distinguished themselves for being a group that makes its payments on time and they say the key is being a very close group with a lot of communication.

Sandra is one of the women in the group. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband. They have 2 children, a 12 year old boy and a 7 year old girl. They are in middle and primary school. Seven months ago, Sandra decided to open a small paper store in her home. She has stocked it little by little, but she still needs a wider variety of products to compete with the more established paper stores in the neighborhood. She hopes that with the help of this loan, she will finally be able to stock her store with the products she is lacking to be able to establish herself as one of the leading paper stores in the neighborhood. She hopes that in the next few years she can keep growing with her business and someday enlarge the space where she has her paper store.

loans.use: to finish stocking her paper store and enlarge it more.

loans.name: Ektemal

texts.en:
Ektemal is a 46-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of three children. She sells clothes and works from her house. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Ektemal is looking to establish a shop for her business in addition to providing an adequate amount of money to insure her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is aged 36 and has been in farming for twelve years. She runs a mixed farm which produces mainly bananas, tea and milk. The milk is partially consumed within the family and the rest sold in the local market together with the bananas and tea in order to meet other family needs. Evelyn married with three children, aged between sixteen and three.

Evelyn has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to  buy poultry chicks for a venture into poultry farming.She also plans to install a water tank and irrigation pipes as soon as possible to enable harvesting and  have water both for domestic use and farming. She puts an emphasis on the farming  business as the source of income which will help in feeding and educating her children.

Evelyn adds that Juhudi Kilimo has helped farmers including herself in improving their living standards.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Dickson Kinoti

texts.en:
Dickson is a farmer in the Nkuru area of Central Kenya where he has been in active farming for twelve years. He sells his produce of milk, beans and tomatoes on the local market. Dickson is aged thirty-two and married with three children with the firstborn being seven years old  and the last one aged three years.

Dickson has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. He says this will improve his farming and  earn him more income to improve his family's living standards. He plans  to buy a chuff-cutter (to cut fodder) and install electricity in his residential house with income from his farming business.

Dickson says  lack of security remains  a threat to the farming business since  thieves steal farm produce before the harvest. He adds that animal diseases rank second after theft as a challenge.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Samson M'arimi

texts.en:
Samson is a farmer and also works as an electrician and a barber. He lives with his family, his wife and one child, in their home town of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He has been in farming for five years and sells his produce of  tomatoes, beans and trees on the local markets.

He has made a loan request amounting to 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy chicks.He says his main focus with the farming business is to educate his child and improve the living standards of his family. He also plans to buy two more dairy cows and construct a zero-grazing unit for his dairy animals.

Samson laments unreliability of rainfall and the high cost of farming inputs like herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: John Mugiira

texts.en:
John is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and earns income from both his work as a cobbler and as a farmer. He has been in farming for twelve years with farming providing for the major part of his family needs. His produce includes tomatoes, beans, cabbages and maize which go to the local market.

John has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets. He says this will help him expand his farming into pig production as well. He says his hopes are high that pig farming will provide enough income to expand his farming on all fronts and make it his core business.

He too laments high costs of inputs and low prices for farm produce which is occasioned by farming only when seasons are on.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Ellyjoy

texts.en:
EllyJoy, a 33-year-old mother of two children aged 12 and 2 years, has been farming for 10 years, selling her banana and milk products in local markets. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of feeds, aggravated by inadequate rains that prevent her from achieving self-sufficiency in their growth.

Because there are ready markets for poultry in the area, EllyJoy is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. She says this new venture will boost her farming income due to the limited number of local poultry farmers. She plans to add more dairy cows to her farm once her new enterprise is firmly established.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 52-year-old widowed mother of two adult children aged 31 and 21 years, has been farming for over 20 years, mainly producing bananas and milk for the local market. Rose also operates as a wholesaler of bananas which she sources from her farm and from other farmers in the area.

Rose has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy irrigation equipment in order to expand her banana farming. She hopes to do well with the expansion since she has a strong market base for her products. The income will help her to pay the college tuition fees for her last-born child.

Rose says the high costs of farming inputs is a deterrent to many people considering entry into the farming business. She adds that farmers need proper training in agricultural techniques in order to reap profits from their investments.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 48-year-old married man from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan and a father of seven children. He is the proud owner of a small grocery store, and he is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to purchase diffferent types of goods for his store.

Ibraheem is looking to open new branches of his store and providing an adequate amount of money to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase various goods for his store

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her husband.

sanaa is a 33-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of three children. She sells clothes and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Sanaa is looking to establish a shop for her business thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Because Fatimah is a conservative woman, she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Fatimah is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of seven children.

Fatimah is looking to improve her family's life conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to do maintenance for her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat is 43 years old and married. She has three children. She lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. 

She has been managing a farming business for almost seven years. She grows rice, beans and vegetables during the two seasons of the year. She describes herself as a humble villager but she is diligent in her business. 

Now, Tat is requesting a loan through HKL to purchase buffalo to keep for her farming work. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income and save some of it for future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to purchase buffalo to keep for her farming work.

loans.name: Siala Iosua

texts.en:
Siala is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea Pitonuu. She is married and has six adult children.  

To make a living, Siala raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Siala has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2008, Siala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Siala has successfully repaid previous loans such as a recent loan of 2,100 used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Siala is now requesting a new loan of 2,450 WST, which will be used to purchase items such as manure and gromozones. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Siala from SPBD. Siala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as manure and gromozones.

loans.name: Nawindsongti Group

texts.fr:
Mme NAWINEBARKA  est la représentante du groupe NAWINDSONGTI. Elle est mariée  et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 06  vont à l’école. Elle a 10 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du soumbala  depuis  1998 (13ans). Son activité de tissage s'est amélioré. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de Bissighin  en ville .Ses clients sont  les  ménagères (femmes).

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de 100kg de grains de néré pour la fabrication du soumbala et du fil de tisse.

 Avec  ses bénéfices, elle a pu améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité de vente de soumbala et développer son activité de tissage récemment commencer et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Nawinebarka is the representative of the NAWINDSONGTI group.  She is married and the mother of 6 children.  Her oldest child is 21 years old, the youngest is 4.  All six children are in school.  Nawinebarka has a total of 10 people in her care.

Nawinebarka has been selling soumbala (a condiment made from fermented néré seeds) since 1998 (13 years).  Her weaving business has improved since her last loan. She buys her supplies in town at the Bissighin market.  Her clients are housewives (women).

She wants to buy one bag containing 100 kilos of néré seeds to make some soumbala.  She also wants to purchase some weaving thread.

With her profits, she was able to improve her family's living conditions. Her ambition is to sell more soumbala and to further develop her weaving activity, which she just started, in order to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy one bag containing 100 kilos of néré seeds to make soumbala, and to buy some weaving thread.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 45 years old and lives in Prey Chor district. She is a loving mother of seven children. 

Her primary business is rice husbandry. She has worked alongside her husband for years. She is able to earn a suitable income for living. On the other hand, some of her children who now are employed in Phnom Penh also share their income to help the family.

Suon would like to ask some funds to purchase a motorcycle for the entire family’s use. Since her family won’t need to spend on transportation fees any further, it will improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the entire family’s use.

loans.name: Aomalu Tanuvasa

texts.en:
Aomalu is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vailoa Palauli. She is married and has two school-age children.  

To make a living, Aomalu runs a general store. Aomalu has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month.

In 2008, Aomalu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Aomalu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

Aomalu is now requesting a new loan of 2,400 WST, which will be used to purchase stock such as toilet paper, sugar, rice, salt, flour, lollies, snacks, milk and noodles. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Aomalu from SPBD. Aomalu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as toilet paper, sugar, rice, salt, flour, lollies, snacks, milk and noodles.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Amélé est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un peintre bâtiment. Elle a 5 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.
Amélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des tubercules pour tous clients à domicile et dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Amélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tubercules. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Amélé voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et faire aussi de l’élevage. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amélé is a 34-year old woman. She is married to a house painter. She has five children, three of whom are in school. The oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest four years old.

Amélé has been working as a vendor since 1992. She sells yams to the public at large out of her home and in town. She stocks up in Lomé. She works by herself. At present, her main challenge is low stock.

Amélé has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy yams. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, she would like to expand her business and also do farming. She says that, thanks to her profits, she plans to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en:
Hijran is a 51-year-old married woman with two daughters. 

She is a market vendor. When she retired, her pension was too small to exist and she decided to start her business. She has seven years of experience in the trading field. 

She sells office supplies, which are very popular for offices and schools. Products she sells are in very high demand and Hijran wishes to meet her customers’ needs. Her monthly income is 300 AZN. 

She applied for 1,800 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales. She already had two loan from AqroInvest and has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Elqun

texts.en:
Elqun is a 23-year-old single man. He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. Elqun has two years of experience in this field, which has made him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

Food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 350 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his shop's good location in the central bazaar of his home city. He also keeps cattle. 

Since the shop is his main source of income, most of the profit goes to his family and there is not enough left to reinvest in the business. For this reason, he has difficulty covering customers` demands. 

Elqun would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will buy more products and diversify his stock. This will be his second loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products and diversify his stock.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a thirty-nine-year old Iraqi woman, a mother of four children.  With five years experience in the sewing and tailoring field, Amina has been attracting clients with her high quality work, thereby contributing to the family's income. Working from home, Amina makes sure all that her household obligations are met and also ensures that her customers are satisfied by the work she is producing.

In the past, Amina successfully applied, received and repaid a loan to Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, which she used to buy an air conditioner, heater unit and some small furniture items.
 
Now Amina wants to borrow a loan to make further improvements to her work area by renovating and renewing the places she uses for the sewing and tailoring work.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renovate and improve her work area.

loans.name: Noura Khori

texts.en:
Noura is photographed in her beauty salon.  She is a thirty-three-year-old young woman, married and a mother with two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a taxi driver who earns a salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's costs.

For the past fifteen years, Noura has been opening a beauty salon, which has been a profitable project.

Noura is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of improving the salon's condition such as: installing new internal decorations, installing mirrors and painting.  This will improve the salon conditions by having a new look, which will attract new customers and increase Noura's income.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed in his barber shop.  He is a thirty-five-year-old man, married and a father with two sons and one daughter.

For the past five years, Mohammad has been running a barber shop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit such as: hair dryers, hair brushes and hair and face creams. This will improve Mohammad's work and increase the size of his work and so improve the family's income.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase a new barber kit.

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is photographed next to the bedroom furniture he will purchase.
Nabeel is a 37 years old man, he is married and a father with one son and five daughters, he is employed with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

Nabeel is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture for him and his wife. This will offer to Nabeel and his wife comfortable furniture and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Grupo Solidoario El Cerro Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Bilma tiene 33 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y honrada, junto con ella vive sus dos hijos los cuales le ayudan en su actividad, ella vive en una aldea de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras, su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy estratégico donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades, ya que viene trabajando con ellos dese hace 5 años.
Doña Bilma el crédito lo necesita para la  compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, azúcar, refrescos, lácteos y pollo, de esta manera ella piensa satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus cliente los cuales desde muy temprano visitan su negocio.
Doña Bilma tendrá un impacto con el financiamiento que  podrá abastecer mas su negocio, y así  contrarrestar la demanda de producto que le hacen a diario, como también generarse mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Bilma tiene sus planes a futuro que son hacer crecer su negocio y mandar sus hijos a la universidad.
Estanislao se dedica a su pulpería y servicio de molino a tiempo completo.
Gelmy su negocio es la venta de tortillas todos los días.
Xiomara ella vende tortillas y tamalitos pisques.
Brenda su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Bilma is a hard-working and honest 33 year old woman who lives with her two children who help her with her business in the town of Choluteca, in the southern Honduras.  Her business is in a very strategic location where there is a heavy flow of customers since she has been working with them for the last 5 years.  
Bilma needs this loan to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausage, sugar, sodas, dairy products and chicken in order to satisfy the needs of her customers who from very early in the morning begin to visit her place of business.  
Bilma will receive the financial benefit from being able to maintain the inventory of her business and in that way offsetting the daily demand for products, as well as generating better earnings to give a better quality of life to her family.  Bilma has plans for her future; she wants to make her business grow and send her children to college.  
Other group member Estanislao makes a living in his local grocery store and mill service working full time; another member Gelmy sells tortillas every day as his business; Xiomara also sells tortillas and tamales pisques (tamales stuffed with black beans) and Brenda sells new clothes to earn money.  

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausage, sugar, sodas, dairy products and chicken for their business.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me, 51, is from Kampot province. She has been living there with her family: her husband and eight single children. Most of her children are students and depend on the income generated from cultivation of the land by her and her spouse. She also gets some help from her children. Rice is the common crop she prefers to grow twice a year. 

Now Me would like to apply for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for business and home use. She hopes it will provide good transportation for the family to anywhere they wish without taking any taxi services as in the old time.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for business and home use.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum, a 63-year-old widowed woman with six children, resides in Kompong Speu province. 

She is in the business of cultivating rice on her inherited farmland. She has become a single parent since her husband passed away a few years ago. And currently she lives with only a single child, while the other five live around the province.

Now she would like to increase her crop production to provide economic stability for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a couple of cows to keep for the farming business. She aspires to have a good harvest from her existing business each year.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows to keep for the farming business.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak, 55, is from the village of Prey Chor in Kompong Cham province. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Her daughter now is working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. 

Kak has only a primary-school education and has been farming for many years. She commonly grows rice twice a year. She is lucky to have a supportive husband who always helps her manage the work at the field.

She is looking for a loan to purchase a cow and to pay for the process of dry-season rice cultivation. She expects this investment to increase the family income by 25 percent.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to pay for the process of dry-season rice cultivation.

loans.name: Jameel Al-Fawakseh

texts.en:
Jameel is photographed next to his taxi.
Jameel is a 45 year old man. He is married and a father of two sons. For the past 10 years, Jameel has been a taxi driver, which has been a profitable project.

Jameel is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi and making some repairs to his house, such as painting and changing the tiles. Taking this loan will allow Jameel to move from one place to another and work extra hours and take more customer requests.  This will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing the taxi and making some repairs to his house

loans.name: Basem Morshed

texts.en:
Basem is photographed in the home appliances store, next to the television he wants to purchase.
Basem is a 31 year-old young man. He is married and has no children yet. He is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover all life's costs and expenses.
Basem is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing a new television and new living room chairs for his house. This will create for Basem and his wife better and more comfortable home living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a television and living room chairs

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Эльмире 27 лет, замужем, воспитывает дочку 3 лет. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, Эльмира   с 2005 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы, 3 теленка, 1 лошадь, что позволяет ей иметь 15,000 сом ежемесячной прибыли. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Эльмира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Elmira is 27 years old, married, and raising a three-year old daughter. In the search of a source of income for her family, since 2005 Elmira launched a livestock business, with a starting capital of 30,000 KGS. Thanks to Elmira’s hard work, her livestock currently includes three cows, three calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of 15,000 KGS. 

In order to continue growing her business , Elmira turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to buy bulls for fattening and resale. Elmira plans to use the revenues from her loan for a further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 47 years old and from the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. Angela is engaged in furniture making such as tables, chairs and beds made from wood. Angela is married with 5 grown children. She is a very responsible person and loving wife to Ricardo. Angela is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy wood and materials needed in her business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa Balagat

texts.en: A very loving and responsible Ma. Theresa is a single mom who has one son. She is engaged in a retail store where she sells different products such as soy sauce, rice, vinegar and oil to the people of the community. Ma. Theresa is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional products that she can offer in the community such as canned goods, snack foods and drinks, in order to have more income so she can meet the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her retail business

loans.name: Grupo Brisas Los Arcos Group

texts.es:
La Señorita Merlín, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, joven con visión emprendedora y futurista ya que a su temprana edad ha iniciado con su negocio y actualmente sigue cursando sus estudios secundarios y cuando anda en clases su madre le ayuda en la administración del negocio, ella reside en la casa de habitación de sus padres en Danli, El Paraiso.
Merlín, se dedica al comercio con una experiencia de 3 años de administración del mismo y su principal actividad es una pulpería misma que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “Ángel”. en su negocio se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser azúcar, arroz, manteca, café, pan, espaguetis, papel higiénico, etc.
Merlín solicita el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, manteca, pastas, maíz, refrescos y otros productos de uso diario, ella con este crédito tendrá un impacto en su negocio de aumento de producto y esto le traerá mas clientes para tener mejores ventas.
Merlín sueña con ayudar a sus padres para que toda la familia tenga una mejor vida y desea terminar sus estudios.
Don Leandro cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz y frijoles.
Don Elvin, se dedica a la compra de reses destazadas y las vende en su carnicería.
Don José, se dedica a la compra de reses para el destazo también las vende en su carnicería.

Danlí, El Paraíso Honduras - Marzo de 2012
texts.en:
Merlín is an 18 year old young woman who is single and has an entrepreneuring vision and a forward-thinking perspective.  At her young age she has begun her own business and currently is finishing her high school education.  She lives in Danli, El Paraiso in her parents' home, and when she has to go to school for classes, her mother helps with the administration of the business.  

Merlín has 3 years of experience in the administration of this business, which is a local grocery store which goes by the name of "Pulpería Ángel".  In her business, the most sold items for daily consumption are beans, rice, butter, pastas, corn and other staple products, and with this loan Merlín will see the impact in an increase in product, which will bring her more customers and as a result, better sales numbers.  

Merlín dreams of helping her parents so that her whole family has a better life, as well as finishing her studies.  Other group member Don Leandro has 10 years of experience buying and selling corn and beans; Don Elvin and Don José make a living buying freshly butchered beef and selling it in their respective butcher shops.  

Danlí, El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, butter, pastas, corn, soda and other products for his business.

loans.name: Patricia Tumabao

texts.en: Patricia is a vendor selling fruits and vegetables in her village. This kind of business allows her to gain an income for the sustainability of her family. She is married to a farmer and has three children. As of now, she has insufficient funds to buy vegetables. She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy eggplant, cabbage, pechay, camote and string beans. In the future, she hopes that her business will become more productive in terms of income so that she can lessen her family's current poor-living situation.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, pechay, camote and string beans

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old, with 8 grown children. She has been engaged in furniture making for 8 years. She is very diligent and a kind person, not only in her family, but also in the community. Veronica is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy materials needed in her furniture business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 53 years old and from the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. She has 4 adult children. Lydia has been engaged in furniture making such as beds, tables and chairs, for 20 years. Lydia is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy wood and other materials needed in her business. In the future, Lydia hopes that her business expands and she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: A very dedicated mother to her family, Pacita is 56 years old with three grown children. She lives in the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. Pacita manages a store where she sells different vegetables and fruits to the people in the community. Pacita is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas to have additional income. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas for her business

loans.name: Edwin Ochieng Ayaya

texts.en: Edwin is a businessman who repairs phones to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50000 KES to buy spare phone parts.

loans.use: to buy spare phone parts.

loans.name: Hamidan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan bibi is a 49-year-old, married woman. By this relationship, she has two sons. 

Hamidan and her husband are both very hardworking people. They help each other manage the finances of the home. Hamidan sells vegetables while her husband works in the transportation business. 

Hamidan’s business is home-based. She sells vegetables in a cart near her home's front door. Her clients are community members who buy vegetables from her. She sells fresh vegetables at reasonable rates. Her clients prefer buying from her due to the excellent service she provides.  

Hamidan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her vegetable-sales business. With the loan investment, she will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.
 
She is very hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amos Kibicho

texts.en:
Amos, who is from Njambini, has a milk-selling business that he has been operating for the past five years. He is 31 years old and married to his wife, Mary.

Amos has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him add more liters of milk to his business. He is optimistic that his business will do well after he receives the loan.

Amos hopes to become the leading milk dealer in the area, enabling him to increase his income and eventually buy a pickup truck.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Naomi Wanjiku   Mwangi

texts.en:
Naomi is 26 years old and married with two children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years.

Naomi describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. She describes her customers as low-income earners because they live in slums. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Naomi has been able to save money and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a 40,000 KES loan to buy potatoes, onions and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Petronillah

texts.en:
Petronillah is 38 years old and married. She is blessed with six children, ages 20,17,15,13, 9 and 4. She practices dairy farming, which she began doing three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Petronillah has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase animal feed to enable more milk production. The anticipated profits will help her repay her loan as well as improve her animals’ productivity. This is her first loan.

Petronillah's dream is to own a big dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed for her cow to enable more milk production.

loans.name: Agata Rwamba Nyaga

texts.en:
Agata is 51 years old and married with four children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has employed two people. Agata also does farming to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Agata has been able to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 100,000 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia bibi is a 49 year-old married woman with three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons work in a factory while her daughter stays at home and does decorative embroidery work. She also manages the household work. Safia’s husband works in a factory, which provides a meager income.

Safia herself is also very supportive. Besides managing her household responsibilities, she also financially supports her family by operating a clothing business. She is an expert in her business and has been doing it for more than 10 years. She buys clothes from different places, which she sells to her customers to earn a profit. The profit she earns enables her to pay for utilities. 

Safia has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in larger quantities to resell. She is very confident about expanding her business after a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a 51 year-old widow blessed with three children. She practices dairy farming, which she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of 12000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 20000 KES to purchase a dairy cow for additional milk production. This is her first loan.

The anticipated profit will be used to venture into other forms of farming. Her dream is to own a big dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad, ella tiene una hija, Ana su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería desde hace más de 6 años, ella es madre soltera.
Ana solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en un punto estratégico en su hogar, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo Ana, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y ayudarla a salir adelante con sus estudios, ella trabaja  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar.
Ana tiene uno de sus sueños que es tener una de las mejores pulperías de la zona.
La Señora Ramona,  se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y platos de comida.
La Señora Blanca, se dedica a la venta de comida y golosina como tajaditas, baleadas, hot dog, pan con carne, ella tiene 4 años de experiencia en el mismo. 

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Ana is a 36 year old single mother of one daughter whose principal business activity is selling groceries, which she has been doing for the last 6 years.  Ana is requesting support in order to purchase products like sugar, butter, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and other staple products which will help her achieve good customer service.  She has her business strategically located in her home, and the support of the requested loan will contribute to the improvement of Ana's business which will allow her to have better earnings.  This will cover household costs and give a better quality of life to her daughter and help her to get ahead with her studies; she works very hard to create a strong family legacy.  

One of Ana's dreams is to have one of the best grocery stores in the area.  Another member Ramona makes a living selling nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) and other dishes, while Blanca has been selling prepared food and candy such as "tajaditas" (sauteed bananas), "baleadas" (tortillas filled with beans), hot dogs, and breads with meat for the last 4 years.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butter, soap, soda, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and other staples for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has two children. He lives with 11 family members; six of them work.

Ibrahim has owned a food market since 2011. He sells soft drinks, juices, groceries, dairy products, cheese, and frozen beef, chicken and fish. He has sufficient experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to install a sliding door, to buy an electric generator and to add more foodstuffs. He wants to earn a greater profit in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator, to add more foodstuffs and to install a sliding door.

loans.name: Gerardo Alfredo Mendez Ramirez

texts.es:
Gerardo Alfredo, tiene 32 años de edad, está casado tiene dos hijos, vive en el sureste de san Pedro sula.
Hace 3 años que se dedica a realizar su propia actividad de negocio de elaborar y venta de  todo tipo de pan, pasteles y reposterías. El inicio en sociedad con un primo pero decidió  trabajar en forma independiente  y se motivo  porque el  local del negocio está bien ubicado y se vende el producto. El adquirió gran experiencia donde trabajaba. 
Esta solicitando su primer préstamo el cual  lo va invertir en la compra de una motocicleta que ocupa para distribuir productos de la panadería y como su medio de transporte.
Su sueño es expandir mas su negocio, hacer más clientes en las zonas que están a su alrededor.
texts.en:
Gerardo Alfredo, age 32, is married and has two children.  He lives in the southeastern part of San Pedro Sula.

For three years he has been devoting himself to his own business activity.  He makes and sells all types of bread, cakes, and pastries.  He started working with a cousin, but he decided to work independently.  He was motivated because his place of business is in a good location, and his product sells.  He has acquired a lot of experience where he worked.

He is requesting his first loan to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to deliver products from his bakery.  He will also use it as a means of transportation.  His dream is to expand his business and to get more customers from neighboring areas.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to sell pastries.

loans.name: Joaquin Flores

texts.es:
Don  Joaquín es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposa  y  sus cuatro hijos, el vive con su familia en un caserío de namasigue en el departamento de  Choluteca.
Don Joaquín se  dedica  a su negocio de compra y venta  de  ganado  el  préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de reses.
Don Joaquín espera   que  al  finalizar  esta época de  verano  por  lo menos cinco reses sean vendidas. Y que el invierno sea mejor ya que es una  zona  muy  productiva  de mariscos, ganadería  y  otro tipo  de  actividades.
El deseo de Don Joaquín es seguir  trabajando  duro  para  a si   terminar  de  darle a sus hijos  la mejor educación y así  que  sean  personas  de  bien para la sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Joaquin is a very hard-working person who lives with his wife and their 4 children in a settlement called Namasigue in the department of Choluteca, Honduras. Joaquin's business is buying and selling cattle. Joaquin is requesting the loan to buy additional beef cattle.

Joaquin hopes to have sold at least 5 cattle by the end of summer. And he hopes to do better in the winter, since the region is very productive for shellfish, cattle, and other types of activities.

Joaquin wants to continue working hard in order to provide his children with the best education possible so they will become people who benefit society.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a 38 year-old married mother of two young children who don’t go to school. Her husband is a cobbler by profession; he makes shoes. He is very active and efficient in his work. His shoes are of very high quality, and his customers are very satisfied with his work. 

Jamila herself is involved in making parandas (an ornament used to tie back hair). She is very creative in her work. She makes beautiful parandas, including styles that are embroidered, colored or simple. Her product is in high demand among her clients. She does this work to help financially support her family.

Jamila has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her parandas business. With the loan, she will buy required material such as thread and beads in larger quantities for making parandas of better quality and in larger quantities.

She is hopeful that by having enough material she will be able to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase her profits.
